author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In the realm of earth's depth, a quest for purest gold,
Unseen hands unite as one, a standard to uphold.
Four crafters of boundless wealth, to honor's song they hold;
For in the heart of crystals mined, lie tales of honor told.

Upon the eastern dragon’s breath, a plague unseen does brew,
The world's healers seek truth 'midst the celestial hue.
Tales of children, stricken low, stir hearts with fear anew,
A plea for knowledge in the dark, the candle's flame to strew.

In the West, the silvered coin casts a seeming spell,
Yet whispers ‘round the hearth foretell a coming swell.
Though strength does fade, ‘tis not foreseen that it will quickly quell,
Bits of gold in times of need, in pockets they will dwell.

feedItems.title: Mining Industry Seeks to Define One Global Standard for Ethical Practices
feedItems.description: Four key bodies are working to create a single set of codes to simplify sustainability reporting for mining companies.

feedItems.title: WHO Presses China for Data on Undiagnosed Pneumonia Cases
feedItems.description: The WHO has asked China to provide more information on a pneumonia outbreak among children in northern parts of the country, in a rare public statement.

feedItems.title: U.S. Dollar Looks Overvalued But Much Weakness Is Unlikely, MUFG Says
feedItems.description: The dollar is overvalued as the Fed’s tightening cycle is over and there’s a clearer economic slowdown on the horizon, but a major deprecation isn’t lingering, MUFG said.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of Stellantis and Dongfeng's venture, a tale,
Brother Arnulfus doth sing, and raise his ale,
Shares exchanged, a billion's worth in chime,
God bless their deal, may it age like fine wine.

Oh, troubled Brookfield, in their quest for seal,
A failed proposal, yet they didn't kneel,
Bullish in their pursuit to take ownership,
Yet the biggest fish ignored their courtship.

To China's iron, regulators turn their sight,
The price hath jumped, causing quite the fright,
Noble metal used in spire and pylon,
God, guide them well, in light of your scion.

feedItems.title: Stellantis Buys Back Shares From JV Partner Dongfeng
feedItems.description: Stellantis has bought back 50 million common shares from Dongfeng Motor valued at over $1 billion.

feedItems.title: Brookfield Consortium's Revised Origin Energy Offer Fails to Convince Biggest Shareholder
feedItems.description: A consortium led by Brookfield Asset Management made last-ditch changes to its near $11 billion offer for Origin Energy but failed to convince Origin’s biggest shareholder to back the deal.

feedItems.title: China Regulators to Step Up Oversight of Iron-Ore Market After Prices Jump
feedItems.description: Chinese regulators pledged to step up oversight of the nation’s iron-ore market after a surge in prices for the main ingredient in steel, used in everything from apartments to bridges and electricity pylons.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Beneath the Southern Cross, there lies a drawing board,
Where goats who trade in iron, coal, have seen their yield ignored.
Like rabbits in their wind-taut boroughs, woe is their new award,
In the Aussie market garden, the harvest is now poor'd.

In the land of dragon's breath, a hopeful turn's afoot,
Property, like patient snail, finds favor and bears fruit.
Defaulting dogs now barking loud, for 'White List' they salute,
Hong Kong rings with gleeful clatter, the creditors' dispute.

From Zion, hawkish messages, in Gaza they're enwrapped,
Beastly artillery and fire, like frightened hares are mapped.
A blockade, much like steadfast dog, has all resources zapped,
In a world of twisted shell games, peace's cloak is badly capped.

feedItems.title: Australia Shares Close 0.6% Lower
feedItems.description: Australia’s S&P/ASX 200 ended 0.6% lower amid broad-based losses, led by the materials and energy sectors.

feedItems.title: China Property Stocks Jump on Hopes for 'White List' Financing
feedItems.description: Chinese property stocks climbed in Hong Kong trade amid rising hopes that Beijing will soon make dozens of companies eligible for financing, including developers that have defaulted on debt.

feedItems.title: Israel's Military Strategy in the Gaza Strip, Mapped
feedItems.description: The tactics includes airstrikes, artillery bombardment, urban warfare and a fuel blockade.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In London's grand halls, where riches unfold,
Brave hearts buy homes, though markets are cold.
With valor unyielding, their dread they defy,
Like Odin in battle, their souls touch the sky.

From this Yankish shore, a journey takes wing,
To Plymouth, our hearth, where the Skalds do sing.
The turkey's tale echoes in lore and song,
E'er reminding us, to where we belong.

Hear, hear, the clash of Colt's steely might,
Challenging rivals in commerce’s fight.
In their quest for power, like Thor's thunder deemed,
Billions they offer, in gold, brightly gleamed.

feedItems.title: London's Luxury Home Market Has Been Dragging for Years. These Sellers Are Diving in Anyway.
feedItems.description: Despite a drop in deal volume, prices remain steady in Prime Central London—and some are taking the leap.

feedItems.title: To Better Understand the Story of Thanksgiving, Follow the Mayflower Back to Plymouth
feedItems.description: A ‘reverse pilgrimage’ to Plymouth, U.K.—from which the famed ship sailed—offers a telling perspective on America’s beginnings, which can be hard to find this side of the pond

feedItems.title: Colt Makes $1.74 Billion Offer for Vista Outdoor, Gate-crashing Rival Deal
feedItems.description: Firearms manufacturer Colt CZ Group has made an unsolicited offer to acquire U.S. -based Vista Outdoor that values its equity at $1.74 billion, seeking to block the latter’s proposed merger with a Czech industrial technology company.
